alert.note: Alert for Warren (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 21 at 8:32PM EDT by NWS State College
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT WARREN COUNTY THROUGH 900 PM EDT... At 832 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 19 miles northeast of Meadville to Oil City. Movement was northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Warren, Sheffield, Columbus, Youngsville, Russell, Spring Creek, Scandia, Lottsville, Grand Valley, Warren South, Garland, Kinzua Dam, Chapman State Park, Tidioute, Sugar Grove, Starbrick, Clarendon and Bear Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM EDT for north central Pennsylvania.
